text: Today I shared with Sandra and Juan Miguel the pain for the death of his son Daniel, second lieutenant of Carabineros, murdered in the line of duty
There was also his grandmother, who in 1986 lost his son Pablo, petty officer of the Carabineros, also murdered in the line of duty.
I ask the members of the Concertación and the PC not to continue to obstruct the law that will better protect the life of our Carabineros
I ask these same parliamentarians to approve the law that gives better instruments to carabineros to fight the hooded delinquents

Today, I visited the Sheikh Zayed Housing Program and reviewed the progress of their work. We also adopted housing assistance for citizens worth 2.1 billion dirhams
We also directed the officials of the program to complete the 5000 additional requests before the end of this year .. Housing services do not accept postponement or disruption ..

It also reviewed the progress of the transformation of smart services. A new service was launched which electronically collects the beneficiary with the contractor and the consultant to facilitate the procedures
Government housing services are basic services, a right of citizens and a key priority in government vision.
The arrest of Israel Pop Sholom and Alfonso Rax Pop, assassins of the Eduardo Villatoro Cano organization were achieved http://t.co/tb5gN0zTwG
Visited Sheikh Zayed Housing Program to follow up on the work progress, and approved housing aids worth of AED 2.1 billion
We also directed the concerned officials to meet the demands of 5000 additional housing requests before end of year
I also followed up on the progress in moving towards smart services. Now customers & contractors can track their progress online
Government housing services are a key priority, for they represent a basic service and a legitimate right to every citizen

Let me explain. The POMB does not limit the right of any one to demonstrate. It gives NO power to Police to prohibit demonstrations
All the POMB does is define the modality for the Police to exercise its constitutional role of maintaining law and order. Nothing more.
@emanzi our constitution provides that in the enjoyment of one's rights and freedoms, no person shall prejudice the freedoms of others.
@emanzi and who has the duty to ensure that freedoms are exercised in accordance with the law? The Police. The POMB defines how they do so.
@mwineedgar not at all! Where did you get that from?
@josekayemba any good law is blind in its application. If you enact it and you breach it of course it will apply to you as well.
@nkmugisha but the Police can't conceive it differently. They posses no discretionally power in interpreting the law.
@nkmugisha remember the Bill came about after Court struck out of the Police Act a provision giving Police power 2 prohibit demonstrations
@BabloNoor yes, Uganda of the past. Uganda is now a democracy that resolves issues through a democratic process@Jadwong @emanzi
@BabloNoor that shouldn't happen. When it does, the Police is not above the law also.
